DataElement.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Version Intervention or Procedure Description ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A character string that provides the key details of the intervention. EXAMPLE(S): The details may distinguish between arms of a study (e.g., comparison of different dosages of drug) and/or among similar interventions (e.g., comparison of multiple implantable cardiac defibrillators). Interventions involving drugs may include dosage form, dosage, frequency and duration. (50 mg/m2, IV (in the vein) on day 5 of each 28 day cycle. Number of Cycles: until progression or unacceptable toxicity develops.)

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Version Intervention or Procedure Description
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.

The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.
